title: Thor's Natalie Portman and husband Benjamin Millepied hit red carpet
text:
Benjamin and Natalie hit the town in LA last night (Picture: Rex Features)

They’re rarely pictured at showbiz events together, but Oscar-winning actress Natalie Portman and her choreographer husband Benjamin Millepied made an exception last night.

The pair looked sensational as they hit the red carpet for the LA Dance Project gala on Saturday night.

Benjamin, who has worked as the director of dance at Paris Opera Ballet, is the founder of the project, with the 42-year-old opting for a simple all-black suit for the occasion.

Meanwhile Natalie, 38, also went for a monochrome theme, in a sheer, tiered gown in silver and black.

The pair, who share an eight-year-old son, Aleph, and a two-year-old daughter, Amalia, had eyes for one another, as they wrapped their arms around each other and smiled for the cameras.

Another day, another elegant look for Natalie (Picture: PA Images)

Natalie’s night out follows the discussion of her return to the Chris Hemsworth-starring Thor film franchise, as she reunites with the Marvel Cinematic Universe again.

She last month told Entertainment Tonight’s Ash Crossan: ‘They came to me with the idea and said, “We have this idea for you that was a storyline in some of the comics where Jane becomes Lady Thor.” ‘And I was like, “This is very exciting!”’

Natalie played scientist Jane Foster in the 2011 original and its follow up, Thor: The Dark World. She was absent from 2017’s Thor: Ragnarok but will return for the upcoming Thor: Love and Thunder.

In a recent interview with Harper’s Bazaar, the actress hit out at society for leading her to believe she was upset when actually she was angry.

‘We’ve been socialised to believe that we’re not feeling angry – we’re feeling sad, we’re feeling upset,’ she said.

Natalie’s eye-catching gown from behind (Picture: MEGA)

‘And when I realised that, there was a sudden shift in my mind, and I thought, “oh my God, all those times when I would burst into tears, I was actually angry!”

‘I just didn’t know how to express it.’

She added that she also believed that being valued for your beauty is ‘tenuous’ because it ‘lives for a second’.

Natalie won the Best Actress Oscar for Black Swan in 2012. Her other films include Jackie and upcoming Lucy In The Sky.
